full_summary:
**Oxford Economics Subscription**
 Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN)

**Introduction:**
The Atlantic Canada Opportunities Agency (ACOA) intends to award an advance contract to Oxford Economics USA Inc. for the provision of economic research products and data, including econometric models, to support policy and program development within the Agency.

**Background:**
ACOA seeks to purchase economic research products and data, including econometric models, on a web platform accessible to up to 10 Agency employees. The research products will cover economic outlooks and trends, including the tourism sector, and national and provincial economic forecasts. These products are unique and can only be accessed through this direct purchase with Oxford Economics, as the company holds exclusive title to the intellectual property.

**Trade Agreements:**
This procurement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), the Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, and the Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement.

**Justification:**
Due to the exclusive nature of the intellectual property, there are no other suppliers capable of providing the required products and data in Canada. The subscription will enable the Agency to participate in webinars and access reports on national and global economic trends impacting Atlantic Canada.

**Contract Details:**

* Contract Period: March 15, 2024 to March 14, 2025
* Estimated Contract Value: $99,074.00 USD (GST/HST extra)
* Service Location: Prince Edward Island, New Brunswick, Nova Scotia, and Newfoundland and Labrador

**Supplier's Right to Submit Statement of Capabilities:**
Suppliers who consider themselves fully qualified and available to provide the required goods, services, or construction services may submit a statement of capabilities in writing to the contact person identified in this notice on or before the closing date of February 23, 2024, at 12:00 p.m. AST.

**Contact Information:**
For inquiries and statements of capabilities, please contact Josee Belliveau, Senior Procurement Officer, at tenders-soumissions@acoa-apeca.gc.ca or (506) 269-2829.
